stimulusHtml: The spectrum of radiation emitted by a blackbody can be represented with a graph of the radiated intensity per unit wavelength as a function of wavelength. Such a graph exhibits a peak wavelength at which the intensity per unit wavelength is a maximum. Two spherical blackbodies, Sphere X and Sphere Y, are at the same temperature, while Sphere X has a greater mass and greater surface area than Sphere Y. Which of the following claims correctly relates the peak wavelengths for the two spheres, and cites evidence or reasoning that supports the claim?
choicesHtml: Sphere X has a longer peak wavelength. The mass of Sphere X is greater than that of Sphere Y.
Sphere X has a longer peak wavelength. The surface area of Sphere X is greater than that of Sphere Y.
The peak wavelength is the same for both spheres. The spheres are at the same temperature.
The peak wavelength is the same for both spheres. Both objects are in the shape of a sphere.
